questions.prompt: During the past month, which statement best describes the kinds of physical activity you usually did as part of your job or work?
questions.text:
(Please, skip if you do not do regular work) 
Do not include activities during breaks or outside of work. Please read all six statements before selecting one.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day sitting or standing.
enumeration.text: When I was at work, I did such things as writing, typing, talking on the telephone, assembling small parts, or operating a machine that takes very little exertion or strength. If I drove a car or truck while at work, I did not lift or carry anything for more that a few minutes each day.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day walking or using my hands and arms in work that required moderate exertion.
enumeration.text: When I was at work, I did such things as delivering mail, patrolling on guard duty, doing mechanical work on automobiles or other large machines, house painting, or operating a machine that requires some moderate-activity work of me. If I drove a truck or lift, my job required me to lift and carry things frequently.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day lifting or carrying heavy objects or moving most of my body in some other way.
enumeration.text: When I was at work, I did such things as stacking cargo or inventory, handling parts or materials, or doing work like that of a carpenter who builds structures or a gardener who does most of the work without machines.

enumeration.label: I spent most of the day doing hard physical labor.
enumeration.text: When I was at work, I did such things as digging or chopping with heavy tools or carrying heavy loads (bricks, for example) to the place where they were to be used. If I drove a truck or operated equipment, my job also required me to do hard physical work most of the day with only short breaks.

questions.prompt: During the past month, which statement best describes the kinds of physical activity you did?
questions.text: Do not include the time you spent as part of your work or job. Please read all six statements before selecting one.

enumeration.label: I did not do much physical activity.
enumeration.text: I mostly did things like watching television, reading, playing cards, or playing computer games. Only occasionally, no more than once or twice a month, did I do anything more active such as going for a walk or playing tennis

enumeration.label: Once or twice a week.
enumeration.text: I did light activities such as getting outdoors on the weekends for an easy walk or stroll. Or once or twice a week, I did chores around the house such as sweeping floors or vacuuming.

enumeration.label: About three times a week, I did moderate activities.
enumeration.text: Such as brisk walking, swimming, or riding a bike for about 15–20 minutes each time. Or about once a week, I did moderately difficult chores such as raking or mowing the lawn for about 45–60 minutes. Or about once a week, I played sports such as softball, basketball, or soccer for about 45–60 minutes.

enumeration.label: About three times a week, I did vigorous activities.
enumeration.text: Such as running or riding hard on a bike for 30 minutes or more each time.

enumeration.label: Almost daily, that is five or more times a week, I did moderate activities.
enumeration.text: Such as brisk walking, swimming, or riding a bike for 30 minutes or more each time. Or about once a week, I did moderately difficult chores or played sports for 2 hours or more.

enumeration.label: Almost daily, that is, five or more times a week, I did vigorous activities.
enumeration.text: Such as running or riding hard on a bike for 30 minutes or more each time.

questions.prompt: Overall, how many minutes of moderate activity do you get in a week?
questions.text: Moderate intensity: A person doing moderate-intensity activity, such as a brisk walk, can usually talk but not sing during the activity.

questions.prompt: Overall, how many minutes of vigorous activity do you get in a week?
questions.text: Vigorous intensity: A person doing vigorous-intensity activity, such as running, usually cannot say more than a few words without pausing for a breath.

questions.prompt: How many hours of sleep do you usually get at night on weekdays or workdays?
Have you ever told a doctor or other health professional that you have trouble sleeping?
Have you ever been told by a doctor or other health professional that you have a sleep disorder?
